title.rendered: The Perks of Being an Fiverr Workspace Member: InVision

content.rendered:
If you work in the design industry, you know how difficult it can be to collaborate on designs with clients and team members. What looks good on your screen may not look good on your client’s screen. Communication about workflow and progress on large projects can become unwieldy with so many ‘moving parts.’ Even just commenting on one page can be trouble. If the client says the buttons need to be bigger, which one do they mean? There are so many ways to comment on a design that are unclear and unhelpful. So how can you collaborate with others on creating quality design interfaces in an efficient and accurate way?
Enter InVision. InVision is a design prototyping and collaboration tool for freelancers and enterprise businesses. It’s an extremely powerful tool used by a majority of Fortune 100 companies for design prototyping. Just take a look at all these happy customers.
InVision doesn’t just let you make static images of your design. It lets you create animations, web code, style sheets, and all the other components necessary for a modern user interface. Plus, you can share the designs as a prototype just by sharing a link. This creates a short movie of your design that you can show off to clients or as part of a portfolio.
InVision also has workflow software baked into the system. It’s quite similar to Trello or similar pinboard workflow software packages. As a simple example, you can have completed, in-progress, and on-hold boards, then under those boards you can sort out each page of your project. You’ll be able to tell who is responsible for each page, create checklists, and collaborate on each page so everyone is kept in the loop.
It also offers version control. Version control lets you easily comment on portions of the design, recommend changes, and experiment with the design without fear of losing previous work. If your client wants to compare the design iteration from three versions ago, it’s easy to bring it up. If you’ve ever had to try to hunt down old designs after you’ve changed them, this is a huge boon.
It’s not just limited to text comments either. You can collaborate with your client or team members in real-time using InVision. It’s all done through the browser. You can also create guided tours and presentations for your clients to introduce your designs. This can be a powerful way to share samples with a prospective client during negotiations.
Stumped on a design? InVision comes with a large variety of templates for creating the underlying basis for whatever app or website you and the client want to create. It’s quite similar to how Canva has pre-built icons and image templates, only these are much more powerful.
Does the client have a preferred collaboration tool? InVision is able to connect with a wide variety of other applications used by freelancers, including Trello, Box, Slack, Google Drive, Dropbox, and a host of others.
If you work in the design industry, this one tool could replace a host of others. Plus, they have a free version where you can try out many of the tools they offer. If you like what you see, we’d like to offer you a special bonus. As a reward for joining AND.CO you can get a three-month free trial of InVision’s enterprise-level package. To claim your discount code and see the other cool benefits you can get for using AND CO, just follow this link.

@graph.name: Emily Hunter
@graph.description: Emily Hunter runs Hunting For Words, a small Atlanta writing firm. Her company's work has been seen all over the world, even in a TED talk! When she's not writer-wrangling, she's cheering for her favorite DCI corps, plotting out new business ideas, and dipping her fingers in ink. If you like Emily's work or want to yammer about business, send her an email at emily@huntingforwords.com.
